title: Obama makes transport funding pledge
description: President Barack Obama says the US must invest more in its infrastructure, in the wake of a train derailment in Philadelphia that claimed eight lives.

title: Ex-Bin Laden aide sentenced to life
description: Ex-aide to Osama Bin Laden, Khalid al-Fawwaz, is sentenced to life in US prison for 1998 US embassy bombings in east Africa that killed 224 people.

title: Obama reassures Gulf allies on Iran
description: US President Barack Obama pledges to stand by his Gulf allies, with military force if needed, amid heightened tensions with Iran.

title: US family has 13th consecutive boy
description: A US couple who already have 12 sons have a 13th baby - and, yes, it's another boy!

title: U2's Edge falls off stage on tour
description: U2 guitarist The Edge says he is fine after falling off stage during the opening night of the band's world tour.

title: US and Cuba to hold embassy talks
description: The US and Cuban governments are to hold talks next week to discuss practical measures to re-establish diplomatic relations.

title: Depp's dogs flown out of Australia
description: Two of Hollywood actor Johnny Depp's dogs are flown from Australia after being threatened with being put down for violating quarantine rules.

title: 'Success kid' raises cash for dad
description: Sam Griner, whose image spawned the 'success kid' meme, is using his fame to raise cash to pay for medical treatment for his father.

title: Tribeca festival begins in New York
description: New York's Tribeca Film Festival kicked off on Wednesday with the world premiere of Saturday Night Live documentary, Live from New York!.

title: Harry Shearer to leave The Simpsons
description: Harry Shearer, who voices Ned Flanders and Mr Burns in The Simpsons, is to leave the show after more than 25 years following a dispute with producers.

title: VIDEO: Aerial footage shows US tornado damage
description: A severe storm has rolled through the southern US, killing at least five people and leaving more than 43 injured.

title: VIDEO: US Ethiopian artist's ode to the 'Afro'
description: A song praising the perfect Afro hairdo features in the new album by Ethiopian artist Meklit Hadero.

title: VIDEO: US police: 'We're everyday people too'
description: The BBC spoke to former law enforcement officers at Police Week in Washington, DC to find out how they think the American public perceives them.

title: VIDEO: Obama calls mums on Mother's Day
description: President Obama marked Mother's Day in the US by calling three mums to thank them "for being great".

title: VIDEO: Black bears charge at tourists in US
description: Tourists at Yellowstone National Park in the US have been chased over a bridge by a family of black bears.

title: VIDEO: Deadly tornadoes rip across US states
description: One person has died and a number of others are missing after tornadoes, heavy winds and hail storms caused widespread damage in several American states.

title: VIDEO: VE Day marked in Washington
description: Victory in Europe day was commemorated in the US with a flypast over the Washington Memorial, featuring many original aircraft from the Second World War.

title: VIDEO: What's kept Obama away from S Dakota?
description: President Obama's visit to South Dakota now means he has visited every state in the US while serving in the White House.

title: VIDEO: Bus driver falls, nearly hits train
description: A bus driver, who was not wearing her seatbelt, fell from her seat and lost control of the vehicle, narrowly missing a freight train.

title: Amtrak disaster as political football
description: The day after the Amtrak derailment in Philadelphia, debate rages over whether it's too soon to talk about Amtrak funding and infrastructure projects.

title: Poundworld sold to US firm for Â£150m
description: US private equity firm TPG has bought bargain retailer Poundworld, which began as a market stall in 1974.

title: Avon shares seesaw amid bid hoax
description: In a wild session of trading, shares of cosmetics firm Avon whipsaw after mysterious reports of a takeover offer.

title: Canada country profile
description: Provides an overview of Canada, including key events and facts about the world's second-largest country

title: Puerto Rico profile
description: Provides and overview as well as facts and figures for this small dependency of the United States situated in the Caribbean

title: St Pierre and Miquelon profile
description: Provides an overview of what remains of France's once-extensive possessions in North America

title: United States country profile
description: Provides an overview of the United States, including key events and facts about this superpower

title: Four days, four Jeb Bush answers on Iraq
description: Jeb Bush's four answers on Iraq war

title: The 24-page US death penalty form
description: The 24-page form to decide Boston bomber's fate

title: VIDEO: Safe space for questioning children
description: Camp for children questioning gender identity

title: VIDEO: US students test worldly knowledge
description: Children who have memorised the globe

title: US train risks explained - in three charts
description: US train risks explained - in three charts

title: The sport reporter and the obscene ranter who lost his job
description: How one female TV reporter confronted her harasser

title: Life after shooting a US president
